case_vignette:
The patient is a 21-year-old male who presents for continued acne therapy. He has had severe acne on his face, chest, and back for years. He is happy with his current acne regimen of topical tretinoin, topical clindamycin, and oral minocycline. He has been on the regimen for years. On examination, you notice significant blue-black discoloration confined to sites of previous acne scars. The patient has no other medical problems and no relevant social or family history. He is a nonsmoker and does not drink alcohol. He is on no other medications. He is a college student and is otherwise healthy.

question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have severe acne on my face, chest, and back, along with a significant blue-black discoloration on the areas where I previously had acne scars.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have had severe acne for years.
Have you used any treatments for acne, especially any containing dapsone?
No, I have not used any treatments containing dapsone. I am currently using a regimen of topical tretinoin, topical clindamycin, and oral minocycline.
Do you have any history of using silver-containing products on your skin?
No, I have not used any silver-containing products on my skin.
Is there a history of similar skin conditions or other dermatological issues in your family?
No, there's no relevant family history of similar skin conditions or other dermatological issues.
Final Diagnosis: Acne conglobata with post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation
